title: Drawing, 1800–25
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on off-white wove paper
markings:
Watermark:  four Russian letters   ..AN.

Verso:  Stamped in black ink: Museum for Decorative Arts Cooper Hewitt
inscribed: Verso: Inscribed in graphite across sheet: p. 8 / R[B?]ig [j?] ht. 3rd row.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A tray, supported by lion feet, whose central pavilion is flanked by vases on columns, by low and by higher bowls, the latter ones are supported by Atlantes standing on round pedestals.  The tray is bordered at its edges by a series of pairs of posts connected by chains.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, graphite on off-white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-2156.
